message: any reason not to alias it to python?
So I got into iPython back when I first started using python, but never got fluent in it, and have only been really using it as part of django extensions shell plus
however after digging hard into vim the last few months and realizing the benefits of superior tools, I want to get more into what iPython has to offer
I can't see any from the top of my head, if you run into problems because of it, it's easy to  remove the alias
But then, why bother? You might as well make a shorter alias, like ipy=ipython for convenience.
It will probably only affect your typing "python" at the shell prompt and nothing else. Shell scripts (except if you explicitly source them yourself) and other programs won't know about the alias.
@RobertKern a shorter alias is a good idea, but swap aliases help me break old habits and muscle memory, like when I aliased mate->mvim
